notes.note:
Firefox now displays images and descriptions for search suggestions when provided by the search engine.

![screenshot of a search suggestion displaying images and descriptions][1]

[1]: https://www.mozilla.org/media/img/firefox/releasenotes/note-images/122_relnote_search_suggest.png

The [translations][1] feature received an improvement in the quality of translated webpages. The results should be much more stable. This fixes issues where the content of a page could disappear when translated, or interactive widgets could break.


  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/website-translation

Firefox now supports creating and using [passkeys][1] stored in the iCloud Keychain on macOS.


  [1]: https://support.apple.com/guide/mac-help/create-a-passkey-mchl4af65d1a/mac

[MDN Web Doc][1] article suggestions from Firefox Suggest will be available in the address bar for users searching for web development-related information.


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/

The line breaking rules of Web content now match the Unicode Standard. This improves Web Browser compatibility for line breaking. An additional improvement for East Asian and South East Asian end users, Firefox now supports proper language-aware word selection when double-clicking on text for languages including Chinese, Japanese, Burmese, Lao, Khmer, and Thai.
Firefox now ships with a new .deb package for Linux users on Ubuntu, Debian, and Linux Mint.

Enabled the [offset-position ][1] property which is useful for most of the [offset-path][2] values. Added support for ray(), [basic-shape][3], [coord-box][4] to the [offset-path][2] CSS property. Added support for [rect()][5] and [xywh()][6] basic shapes on [clip-path][7] and [offset-path][2] CSS properties.


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/offset-position
  [2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/offset-path
  [3]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/basic-shape
  [4]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/box-edge#values
  [5]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/SVG/Element/rect
  [6]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/basic-shape/xywh
  [7]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/clip-path

Firefox now supports animating the SVG [viewBox][1] attribute using [SMIL][2] `by animations`. `by animations` are animations that are relative to the original value. Other attributes such as lengths and angles already support `by`, but a `viewBox` consists of four separate values.


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/viewBox
  [2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/SVG/SVG_animation_with_SMIL

The [LargestContentfulPaint API][1] has been added, this provides timing information about the largest image or text paint before users interact with a web page.


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/LargestContentfulPaint
`<hr>-in-<select>` is now supported, allowing websites to easily use separators inside a `<select>` element.

The [showPicker][1] method is now supported on `<select>` elements, this can be used to trigger the drop-down behavior via JavaScript.


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/HTMLSelectElement/showPicker
The fallback URL parser for unknown schemes was changed to `DefaultURI` this improves specification adherence and web compatibility.

Enabled the [ArrayBuffer.prototype.transfer proposal][1] methods, which enables transferring ownership of [ArrayBuffer][2] data.


  [1]: https://github.com/tc39/proposal-arraybuffer-transfer
  [2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/ArrayBuffer

You can find information about policy updates and enterprise specific bug fixes in the [Firefox for Enterprise 122 Release Notes][1].


  [1]: https://support.mozilla.org/kb/firefox-enterprise-122-release-notes

With the release of Firefox 122, we are pleased to welcome the developers who contributed their first code change to Firefox in this release, 10 of whom were brand new volunteers! Please join us in thanking each of these diligent and enthusiastic individuals, and take a look at their contributions: * AAR.dev: 1862505, 1865895 * Akylzhan: 1862508 * cmj.grubb: 1862504 * jameshendry05: 1682239, 1739307, 1866273, 1866776 * Jiangjin Wang: 1865969 * matthewnewall: 1862511 * Meera Murthy: 1869033 * peterodejobi9: 1837072 * realstealthninja: 1862506 * Vsevolod Buzinov: 1865494, 1869853
Some machines with older AMD CPUs may see image thumbnails incorrectly rendered as all black in file dialogs. If this is the case, updating the graphics driver should address this issue.

system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems (32-bit and 64-bit)
 - Windows 10 or later

### Recommended Hardware
-  1 gigahertz (GHz) or faster compatible processor or System on a Chip (SoC)
-  1GB of RAM / 2GB of RAM for the 64-bit version
-  500MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- macOS 10.15 or later

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 or Apple silicon processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - glibc 2.17 or higher
    - GTK+ 3.14 or higher
    - libglib 2.42 or higher
    - libstdc++ 4.8.1 or higher
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - PulseAudio
title: Firefox 122.0 Release
